name: Scientific Email Polishing Rubric
description: Evaluation criteria for professional scientific email quality

criteria.name: Purpose Clarity
criteria.description: How clear and identifiable the email's purpose is

scores.1: No clear purpose; reader confused about what's being asked
scores.2: Purpose unclear; buried or implied rather than stated
scores.3: Purpose present but could be clearer or more prominent
scores.4: Clear purpose stated early; reader knows what email is about
scores.5: Crystal clear purpose in first paragraph; impossible to miss

criteria.name: Explicit Ask/Action
criteria.description: Quality of the request or desired action

scores.1: No clear ask; recipient doesn't know what to do
scores.2: Vague ask ('let me know'); unclear what's needed
scores.3: Ask present but timeline or specifics unclear
scores.4: Clear ask with timeline; recipient knows what's needed and when
scores.5: Specific, actionable ask with timeline; easy to respond/act

scores.1: Inappropriate tone (too casual for formal, too stiff for close)
scores.2: Tone somewhat off for the relationship or situation
scores.3: Acceptable tone but not optimized for context
scores.4: Good tone matching relationship and situation
scores.5: Perfectly calibrated tone; professional, warm, appropriate

criteria.name: Context and Structure
criteria.description: Quality of context-setting and email organization

scores.1: No context; assumes recipient remembers everything
scores.2: Insufficient context; recipient may be confused
scores.3: Adequate context but structure could be cleaner
scores.4: Good context in opening; well-organized paragraphs
scores.5: Excellent context and structure; scannable, logical flow

criteria.name: Subject Line Quality
criteria.description: How well subject line previews content

scores.2: Vague subject line that doesn't preview content
scores.3: Adequate subject line but could be more specific
scores.4: Good subject line that clearly indicates purpose
scores.5: Excellent subject line; specific, searchable, action-indicating

scores.1: Much too long; walls of text; excessive detail
scores.2: Too long; could be significantly shortened
scores.3: Acceptable length but some unnecessary content
scores.4: Good length; focused content without padding
scores.5: Optimal length; every sentence serves a purpose

passing_note: Average score must be â‰¥ 3.5 for email to be considered polished. Scores below 3 in 'Purpose Clarity' or 'Explicit Ask' require revision.
